go_data.justification: Dysbindin exists as a stable component of BLOC-1, a multi-subunit protein complex involved in intracellular membrane trafficking and organelle biogenesis.
The dysbindin-containing complex (BLOC-1) interacts with SNARE proteins implicated in neurite outgrowth, and primary hippocampal neurons deficient in BLOC-1 display neurite outgrowth defects.
Dysbindin is a component of BLOC-1, which is involved in the biogenesis of lysosome-related organelles.
Dysbindin exists as a stable component of BLOC-1 in the cytosol of brain cells.
